cards.description: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a noble prize and the first person to win two. She won one in chemistry in 1903 and one in physics in 1911.
Dr. Eugenia Duodu is a chemist with a PhD in chemistry from the University of Toronto. She is also the CEO of Visions Science Network for learning.

cards.description: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a noble prize and the first person to win two. She won one in chemistry in 1903 and one in physics in 1911.
Donna Strickland won a noble prize in physics for her work with lasers in 2019. She is a professor at the University of Waterloo.s

cards.description: A NASA mathemetician. Katherine Johnson was the first black women to step foot in a NASA space control room. She helped launch Alan Sheppard and John Glenn into space.

cards.description: A pioneer in computer science. Grace Hopper invented the first computer compiler in 1952 and she experiemented with the idea of automatic programming.

The father of the modern day computer, Alan Turing developed a computer that decoded the enigma machine and many German messages along with it in World War II saving millions of lives and shortening the war. Alan Turing is a fantastic LGBTQ+ role model in STEM. More stuff goes here.

cards.description: Mae Jemison was the first black woman in space. And... I have more great stuff on her, Marie Curie, Donna Strickland, and we need to find great stuff for the others
